corpus.title: Well-Ordering Principle
corpus.description: The well-ordering principle states that every non-empty set of non-negative integers contains a least element.

corpus.title: Existence of Modular Inverse
corpus.description: Modular inverse of a mod n exists iff gcd(a, n) = 1

corpus.title: Integer Division Theorem
corpus.description: Let a and b be integers, with b > 0. Then there exist unique integers q and r such that a = b*q + r and 0 ≤ r < b.

corpus.title: Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic
corpus.description: An integer can be written as a product of primes in a unique way.

corpus.title: Euler's Totient Function
corpus.description: Euler's totient function ϕ(n) is the number of numbers smaller than n and coprime to it.

corpus.title: Euclid's lemma
corpus.description: If a prime divides the product of two numbers, it must divide at least one of those numbers.

corpus.title: Coprime
corpus.description: Two numbers are coprime iff 1 is the only positive number which divides both of them.

corpus.title: Euler's Theorem
corpus.description: If a and n are coprime, then a^phi(n) ≡ 1 (mod n), where phi is Euler's Totient Function.

corpus.title: If x divides ab and x is coprime to a, then x divides b
corpus.description: If a number divides the product of two numbers and is coprime to the first number in the product, then it must divide the second number in the product.

corpus.title: Modular Equivalence
corpus.description: a is equivalent to b mod n iff n divides (a-b).

corpus.title: GCD is the smallest Linear Combination
corpus.description: The gcd of two numbers is their smallest positive linear combination.

corpus.title: Common divisor of two numbers divides their GCD
corpus.description: Commmon divisor of two numbers divides their GCD.

corpus.title: gcd(a/d, b/d) = gcd(a, b)/d
corpus.description: gcd(a/d, b/d) = gcd(a, b)/d

corpus.title: gcd(a, b) = gcd(a-b, b)
Inverse of a group element is unique
corpus.description: Inverse of a group element is unique.

corpus.title: Condition for a subset to be a subgroup
corpus.description: Condition for a subset to be a subgroup.

corpus.title: Conditions for a subset to be a subgroup
corpus.description: Conditions for a subset to be a subgroup.

corpus.title: Order of element divides order of group
Identity of a group is unique
corpus.description: Identity of a group is unique.

corpus.title: Group
corpus.description: A group is a set along with a binary operator which satisfies certain properties.

corpus.title: Group element to the power group size equals identity
corpus.description: a^|G| = e

corpus.title: Inverse of product of two elements of a group
Parity of a permutation
corpus.description: If a permutation can be written as a product of only an odd number of transpositions, it is called an odd permutation. If a permutation can be written as a product of only an even number of transpositions, it is called an even permutation. Every permutation is either an odd permutation or an even permutation.

corpus.title: Canonical cycle notation of a permutation
corpus.description: Canonical cycle notation is a unique way of writing a permutation as a product of disjoint cycles.

corpus.title: Product of disjoint cycles is commutative
Alternating Group
corpus.description: The set of all even permutations is called the alternating group

corpus.title: Permutation is transposition product
corpus.description: Every finite permutation can be written as a product of transpositions.

corpus.title: Symmetric Group
corpus.description: The symmetric group is the set of all permutations where the operation is composition of permutations.

corpus.title: Transposition bijects even and odd permutations
corpus.description: There is a bijection between even and odd permutations. The bijective function multiplies a permutation by a transposition.

corpus.title: Permutation is disjoint cycle product
corpus.description: Every permutation can be written as the product of a unique set of disjoint cycles.

corpus.title: Product of cycles and a transposition
Subgroups of a cyclic group
corpus.description: For an infinite-order cyclic group <a>, subgroups are <a^k> for all k. For a cyclic group <a> of order n, subgroups are <a^k> for all divisors k of n.

corpus.title: Group of prime order is cyclic
Order of elements in cyclic group
corpus.description: Order of elements in a cyclic group.

corpus.title: A cyclic group of order n has ϕ(n) generators
a(bH) = (ab)H for subset H of a group
corpus.description: Multiplication of a coset by a group element is associative. For subset H of a group, a(bH) = (ab)H.

corpus.title: Coset
corpus.metadata: A coset is a set obtained by multiplying every element of a subgroup by a group element.

corpus.title: Two cosets are either identical or disjoint
corpus.description: Two cosets are either identical or disjoint.

corpus.title: gH = H iff g in H
corpus.description: Coset of a subgroup equals the subgroup iff the representative is in the subgroup.

corpus.title: Lagrange's Theorem
corpus.description: Order of subgroup divides order of group. Furthermore, number of cosets equals ratio of orders of group and subgroup.

corpus.title: Inverse of a coset
Size of coset equals size of subset
corpus.description: Size of a coset of a subset equals the size of the subset
